climbs.name: Twitch  (easy start)
climbs.fa: Steve Seats, Kelly Cordner, Dave Pedersen, Louie Anderson, et al

content.description:
Follow 4 new bolts up seam seam just left of original Twitch and finish on last two bolts Twitch. Sustained.

It's easy to set up a top rope on this route from Barnes' mixed 5.9 sport route to the left.
content.protection: 6 bolts with 3 shut anchors. lower off.
content.location: far left side of Ministry wall.

content.description:
Fun route with delicate and technical face climbing on a variety of holds.

The crux comes after the second bolt, which is good because the first bolt is in a weird place and you end up clipping it at your knee.

The guide gives this route 2 out of 5 stars, but if this route was located else where it would be a classic.

Worth doing!
content.location: Starts by traversing the dike that goes up and left of the wall which brings you to the first bolt. The route then wonders slightly left and up.

climbs.name: Scheelite Fight
climbs.fa: Darrell Hensel, Marty Lewis, Jeff Scheuerell - 2017

content.description: bust a hard boulder move, then climb the thin black face
A revival and extension to Dale Bards route coined "Old Funk" in Marty's book.
content.protection: 13 Fixe hangers and 2 Mussy anchor. 70m rope, knot the end.

climbs.name: New World Order
climbs.fa: Louie Anderson, Larry Kuechlin, Dana Knight

content.description:
Very sustained technical face climb that will keep you on your toes the entire way.

This climb is rated 11d in the guide book but felt significantly harder than some other similar graded routes in the area. (IMHO)

With that said, this is a great climb.
content.location: 2nd to last route on the right, just to the right of a small flaring crack.

climbs.name: Never Believe (extended)
climbs.fa: Kelly Cordner, Dave Pedersen, Ethan Banich

content.description: extended to 35m and 50m. Crux above bolt 12. Lesser cruxes above 9,  18 & 20.  If you're going all the way to 50m, belayer should tie in and  lower you to 35m anchor.  Your second can then do the whole 50m route and lower to ground. You rap off. Original anchors at 80 ft. upgraded to hooks.
content.protection: 16 blts to 35m anchor, 21 blts to 50 m anchor.
content.location: you need a 70m rope or a twin rope set up.

content.description: You better Believe it!   As the easiest route on this face, it makes for a good warm up.  The climbing is fairly steep, but with good balance and technique isn't too pumpy.  Occasional in-cuts, a few jams, and descent feet keep it fun.
content.location: I believe that this is the 3rd bolt line left of Pratt's Crack (recommended, but if you only have draws slinging those chock stones might be a problem...)   Follow the obvious weakness moving left or right of the crack as needed.  Lower off, move to next line, repeat...

content.description:
Start up some funky crimps and get established on a little rail. Start up and left doing some techy and powerful moves on some good and some bad crimps. Throw some rad thumb presses and underclings into the mix and then you have arrived at the anchors.

The route was originally 5.12 but after some holds broke, Peter Croft shifted some of the bolts to realign them with a climbable line and the guidebook calls it 13a.
content.location: Bolt line to the climbers right of pocketful of funk, but go right up the black patina face.

content.description: This 70m mega-route is an extension past the 'Neighborhood Watch' anchor, following a right-leaning crack and patina face to the alcove anchor stance.

climbs.name: Inside Out Extension
climbs.fa: Tai DeVore, Mary DeVore, Marty Lewis, 9/2017

content.description: Climb Burning Inside, then move left up face, passing a rounded platform.

Climb Twitch or Easy Twitch start to the anchor ledge at about 70'. Clip anchor draw and continue into the dihedral corner that is the start of the old aid route "Beaks of Paradise". Place small cams to a crux about halfway with 2 bolts. These bolts were placed next to the 2 bashies that were removed to make this a free climb. Do a desperate dihedral crux to a stance and place small cams through easier ground to a bolted anchor above an old stump.
content.protection: 2 bolts + small cams to BD .5. doubles .00 and .0
content.location: to the right of "Rites of Spring"

content.description:
Climb the awkward groove for a few bolts before busting out right and working through some cruxy, balancy moves on sidepulls. Head back left for an easier finish with good rests before the chains.

Not quite as sustained or enjoyable as some of the other routes at Ministry, but the crux sequence is engaging and the route is well-protected.
content.location: second climb from the left end of the wall.

content.description: Layback and jam a flare to some small holds.  Shares an anchor with New World Order.
content.location: Furthest right on the wall, near Pratt's Crack.

content.description:
This is an extension to any of Twitch/Scheelite Fight/Effigy that doubles the length of those pitches with an equal amount of new independent climbing.

Climb the face immediately above the Effigy anchor, ending at the same height as Free Beaks. Patina climbing on slick black rock for it's first half, followed by less featured but more textured face.

With a couple of runners (+gear) it's also possible to finish by linking into Free Beaks at it's last bolt.

Multiple mix/match combinations to be had by combining pitches, or parts of, Twitch/Free Beaks/Scheelite Fight/Effigy/Burning Man.

A 70m is required to lower from the mussies.
content.location: Extension to Twitch/Scheelite Fight/Effigy.  Ends just right of Free Beaks anchor.

content.description:
A fantastic technical face climb. Amazing movement on perfect rock.

Must do!!!
content.location: Located just left of the flared crack in the center of the wall.

content.description:
Climbs the right arete of Rites of Spring, then follows the old aid seams out on the face a little to the right.  Ends at the same height as P2 of Rites of Spring.  Approach via Twitch/Free Beaks.  From the Free Beaks anchor jog left onto Rites of Spring for a few feet (no gear needed) to reach the first bolt on P2.

The logistics of doing this are a little tricky, particularly finding a comfortable belay for the Belly of the Beast (P2.)  Best option is doing Twitch and belaying at the base of Free Beaks, or belaying off the Free Beaks anchor (semi-hanging, not comfortable.)

The stated length of 100' is for the second pitch alone.  It's closer to 65m from the ground with the pitches combined.

Two rope rapp from the top anchor/belay to the ground, or 2 35m rapps.
content.protection: 14 bolts for P2.  Independent anchor right of Rites of Spring P2 anchor.  A few pieces of gear to 1" for Free Beaks.
content.location: Directly above the Free Beaks bolted anchor.
